result.execSummary:
The defendant Laron M. Franklin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Laron M. Franklin is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Laron M. Franklin was found guilty of Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to any previously imposed sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Submit to a DNA sample and pay surcharge.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  DOC shall promptly notify the court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Extended Supervision Imposed by the Judge

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Brenda VanCuick.  Atty Wells provided add'l info to the court and parties.  Add'l sentencing comments made.  Deft sentenced to 8-1/2yrs WSP consecutive to any previously imposed sentence; initial confinement of 42mos followed by 60 mos of ES.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  Firearm warning.  Voting acknowledgment.  Credit for 22 days.  Deft not eligible for CIP or SAP.
Sentencing hearing at 09-16-2015 02:30 pm
Sentencing hrg for 9/2/15 to be rescheduled due to ongoing jury trial; attys notified via email

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lehman.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Brenda Van Cuick.  Sentencing arguments made by all parties.  Court interrupts the sentencing hrg during his remarks; wants add'l information on the Indiana charges.  Balance of sentencing hrg adj to 9/2/15 @ 10:30am.  State to attempt to obtain add'l information on the Indiana charges/disposition.  Deft is scheduled to discharge from his present sentence this Friday; court requests the court keep deft here pending his next court date.

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Brenda Van Cuick.  State dismisses counts 1, 2, & 3.  Deft pleads guilty to count 4; found guilty by the Court.  PSI ordered.  Sentencing set for 8/24/15 @ 2:30pm
to Dismiss Weapons Enhancer - filed by deft

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  ADA Burgoyne appeared for the State.  Atty VanCuick appeared via telephone on behalf of deft Franklin.  Atty Joe Easton appeared via telephone on behalf of co-deft Gallegos.  Brief discussion held.  Cases are severed.  Atty VanCuick's motion for an adjournment is granted; Deft Franklin's case is adjourned to 7/13/15 @ 9am.  Co-deft Gallegos will remain on for trial on 5/18/15.
of Deft to Adjourn Trial - per court, set conf w/all attys asap

Minutes:  Clerk/T. Lema.  Special Pros K R Wells appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Van Cuick.  Defense filed a motion to sever.  Special Pros Wells filed an amended witness list this morning.  Cases may need to be severed based on this add'l witness.  Brief discussion held.  Both this case and the co-deft case are adjourned until 5/18/15 @ 9am.  Motion to sever taken under advisement.
